channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-7117] Partitions not inheriting table permissions after alter rename partition
item.description: On altering/renaming a partition it must inherit permission of the parent directory, if the flag hive.warehouse.subdir.inherit.perms is set.
item.summary: Partitions not inheriting table permissions after alter rename partition

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Thanks for the fix, can you please fix the formatting diffs and create a review board request with the patch? Probably its clearer if the patch just contain code diffs. Thanks!

https://reviews.apache.org/dashboard/
Removed code formatting changes.
szehon Updated patch and posted rb at https://reviews.apache.org/r/21846/.
Left comments on RB.
Add checks for filesystem.rename return value
swarnim updated patch and addressed you reviews at rb.

Thanks Ashish. Left one more minor comment after that.

+1(non-binding) after that.
Rename fileutils.rename to fileutils.renameAndInheritParentPermissions
swarnim Done! The name now is bit long, but shouts out the intent. Thanks for reviewing!

ATTACHMENT ID: 12646460
Avoid using same table in two different tests, which caused test error because of previous patch.
testAlterPartitionsPerms was using same table name as of testAlterSinglePartitionPerm, which led to failure while creating table in testAlterPartitionPerms. .5 patch fixes this. Updated RB.
Avoid using same table in two different tests.
Fixed test failure due to previous patch.
